What did the man who had recently reconciled with his brother tell Debra Gold about older people

In a study of older people with sisters and brothers, psychologist Debra Gold of the Duke Center for the study of aging and human development found that about 20% said they were hostile or indifferent to ward their sisters and brothers.
Only four out of the 54 people interviewed had completely broken with their sisters and brothers and only one of the four felt comfortable with the break
As sisters and brothers advanced into old age, closeness increases and rivalry diminishes, explains VC, a psychologist at Purdue University.
Most of the elderly people he interviewed said they had supportive and friendly dealings and got along well or very well with their sisters and brothers
Gold found that as people age, they often become more involved with and interested in their sisters and brothers.

entry.def: Your brother is a boy or a man who has the same parents as you.

example.ex: Oh, so you're Peter's younger brother...
example.tran: 哦，那么你是彼得的弟弟。

example.ex: Have you got any brothers and sisters?

entry.def: You can describe a man as your brother if he belongs to the same race, religion, country, profession, or trade union as you, or if he has similar ideas to you.
entry.tran: 兄弟；同胞；教友；国人；同行；同志

example.ex: He told reporters he'd come to be with his Latvian brothers.
example.tran: 他告诉记者他是来支持拉脱维亚同胞的。
红衣主教和他的主教们

entry.def: Brother is a title given to a man who belongs to a religious community such as a monastery.
entry.tran: 教徒，修士，僧侣（用于头衔）

example.ex: ...the Christian Brothers community which owns the castle.
example.tran: 拥有这座城堡的公教弟兄会

entry.def: Brothers is used in the names of some companies and shops.
entry.tran: （用于某些公司或商店的名称中）

example.ex: I went to Brooks Brothers and bought myself a decent shirt.
example.tran: 我去布鲁克斯兄弟专卖店给自己买了一件体面的衬衫。

means.word_mean: 1. a male with the same parents as someone else;

sentences.sentence: "my brother still lives with our parents"

means.word_mean: 2. a male person who is a fellow member (of a fraternity or religion of other group);

sentences.sentence: "none of his brothers would betray him"

means.word_mean: 3. a close friend who accompanies his buddies in their activities
4. used as a term of address for those male persons engaged in the same movement;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  brōthor, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch broeder and German Bruder, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin frater
